english:
Kledering Weather Report - November 18, 2025

Temperature: Ranges from -0.3°C to 6.7°C, with apparent temperatures feeling colder due to wind chill, especially in the early morning and evening.

Wind: Moderate northwest winds (avg. 11 km/h, gusts up to 40.7 km/h) will create a noticeable chill, particularly before 10 AM and after 4 PM. Wind speeds drop significantly in the late evening.

UV Index: Low (max 1.8), with peak UV exposure between 10 AM and 2 PM. Sun protection is not critical but recommended for prolonged outdoor exposure.

Precipitation: No precipitation expected. Cloud cover varies, with clear skies dominating the morning and evening, while afternoon brings increasing cloudiness.

Visibility: Excellent (avg. 49.2 km), with no fog or obstructions expected.

Outdoor Activity Recommendations

Morning (7-9 AM): Ideal for running or biking, with temperatures around 3-4°C and decreasing wind speeds. Wind chill may make it feel colder, so dress in layers.

Afternoon (4-8 PM): Cooler temperatures (2-5°C) and light winds make this a suitable window for outdoor activities, though wind gusts may persist until 6 PM.

Evening (after 8 PM): Temperatures drop below freezing by midnight, and wind chill increases. Outdoor activities are not recommended due to cold conditions.

Special Note: Wind chill will make apparent temperatures feel significantly colder than actual readings, especially in the early morning and late evening. Monitor wind conditions for comfort during prolonged outdoor exposure.
